## Description {#details}

Allocate memory in an ever growing pool, as if by bump-pointer.

This isn&#39;t strictly a bump-pointer allocator as it uses backing slabs of memory rather than relying on a boundless contiguous heap. However, it has bump-pointer semantics in that it is a monotonically growing pool of memory where every allocation is found by merely allocating the next N bytes in the slab, or the next N bytes in the next slab.

Note that this also has a threshold for forcing allocations above a certain size into their own slab.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bumpptrallocatorimpl">BumpPtrAllocatorImpl</a> template defaults to using a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mallocallocator">MallocAllocator</a> object, which wraps malloc, to allocate memory, but it can be changed to use a custom allocator.

The GrowthDelay specifies after how many allocated slabs the allocator increases the size of the slabs.

Definition at line 63 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/allocator-h">Allocator.h</a>.

### identifyKnownAlignedObject() {#a7473a4e7b2a9f87d91432add2af05cee}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>int64&#95;t llvm::BumpPtrAllocatorImpl&lt; AllocatorT, SlabSize, SizeThreshold, GrowthDelay &gt;::identifyKnownAlignedObject (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> void &#42; Ptr)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
A wrapper around identifyKnownObject.

Accepts type information about the object and produces a smaller identifier by relying on the alignment information. Note that sub-classes may have different alignment, so the most base class should be passed as template parameter in order to obtain correct results. For that reason automatic template parameter deduction is disabled. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
An index uniquely and reproducibly identifying an input pointer <code>Ptr</code> in the given allocator. This identifier is different from the ones produced by identifyObject and identifyAlignedObject.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/allocator-h/#l00282">282</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/allocator-h">Allocator.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

A wrapper around identifyObject that additionally asserts that the object is indeed within the allocator.

### identifyObject() {#a37fb633e742bf184c02ea432d3b377f0}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["inline"]}>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
An index uniquely and reproducibly identifying an input pointer <code>Ptr</code> in the given allocator. The returned value is negative iff the object is inside a custom-size slab. Returns an empty optional if the pointer is not found in the allocator.
